lexUnit.name: hiss.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a sharp sibilant sound as of the letter s, often as a sign of disapproval or derision.

sentence.text: ` Fifteen ! " she hissed .
` What are you doing ? " she hissed .
` Angalo ! " he hissed .
" Wait outside the office , " he hissed .
“ You bastard ! ” she hissed .
` Less of your lip , Robinson , " hissed Swain .
` Put the bloody thing down , Devlin , " hissed Rohmer .
` You 're mad , you 're crazy , you 're insane , " hissed Jessica .
She turned on him and hissed that Bunny was watching .
She hisses her disapproval , then snatches up the denims , and digs the key from one of the pockets .
She leaned forward to hiss the words in his ear .
Arghatun hissed the word .
From time to time she hissed instructions at teachers or senior girls .
` I tell you it went down that last passage on the right , " hissed Kring in a voice like the scrape of a blade over stone .
` Quiet please in the wings ! " hissed the Stage Manager .
She hissed at Ariel to make him leave , and Ariel would wave him to keep his distance ; Jack did not mind .
Lily hissed at Charlie and darted to the prompt corner .
` It 's two and a half guineas ! " she hissed at Louise , who could tell that she was genuinely appalled .
The women were starting to wail , when he hissed at them to be quiet .
` Listen , " he hissed as the porter walked on oblivious to what was happening behind him .
She hissed back , ` We ca n't tell her , Peter !
Arabella Buckley hissed out the words , but Sven Hjerson thought it very likely they had been carried by the sticky breeze as far as the couple in the prow .
` It 's like talking to a robot , " Graham hissed then glanced at Jenkins and Laidlaw .
